result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+)

records.addlTxt:
Conditions: 
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold.
Letter to defendant with amended signature bond ordered by court 10/06/2022. Request to return signed bond and Affidavit of Witness form to Clerk of Court no later than 10/24/2022.

Conditions: 
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold.

Conditions: 
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license and IID installed. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold.

(Clerk error--IID installed is not a condition of bond, amended bond will be mailed to the defendant for signature)

9:46 AM cases 21CT357, 22CM844 called. Prosecuting Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Richard A LaRock in court with Attorney Matthew Krische. Defendant updates address with the court.

22CM844 Initial appearance: Defense confirms receipt of the complaint and waives reading. Bond is set.
Hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions: 
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license and IID installed. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold.
